00042 {
00043   /* store a file descriptor opened to `filename' in a
00044      static variable. that way, we don't need to open
00045      the file every time this function is called.  */
00046   static int dev_random_fd = -1;
00047 
00048   char *next_random_byte;
00049   int bytes_to_read;
00050   unsigned random_value;
00051 
00052   /* make sure `max' is greater than `min'. */
00053   /* assert (max > min); */
00054 
00055   /* if this is the first time this function is
00056      called, open a file descriptor to `filename'.  */
00057   if (dev_random_fd == -1)
00058     {
00059       dev_random_fd = open (filename, O_RDONLY);
00060       assert (dev_random_fd != -1);
00061     }
00062 
00063   /* read enough random bytes to fill an integer variable.  */
00064   next_random_byte = (char *) &random_value;
00065   bytes_to_read = sizeof (random_value);
00066 
00067   /* loop until we've read enough bytes. since `filename' is
00068      filled from user-generated actions, the read may block,
00069      and may only return a single random byte at a time.  */
00070   do
00071     {
00072       register int bytes_read;
00073       bytes_read = read (dev_random_fd, next_random_byte, bytes_to_read);
00074       bytes_to_read -= bytes_read;
00075       next_random_byte += bytes_read;
00076     }
00077   while (bytes_to_read > 0);
00078 
00079   /* compute a random number in the correct range.  */
00080   return min + (random_value % (max - min + 1));
